xrefdescription.para: If an error occurs on write, consider removing file from targets, or at least attempt to roll the file (out of space?)

memberdef.argsstring: (sirfcache *sfc, const sirchar_t *path, sir_levels levels, sir_options opts)
memberdef.name: _sir_fcache_add

detaileddescription.para: Evaluates whether or not the library has been initialized.
Validates the configuration passed to sir_init.
Maps a sir_mutex_id to a sirmutex_t and protected section.
Maps a sir_level to a syslog level.
Retrieves a buffer from a sirbuf.
Converts a sir_level to its human-readable form.
Determines if a particular destination is registered to receive output for a particular sir_level.
Formats the current time as a string.
Retrieves the current local time w/ milliseconds.
Validates a set of sir_level flags.
Validates a set of sir_option flags.
Checks a bitfield for a specific set of bits.
Places a null terminator at the first index in a string buffer.
Determines if a mutex is locked without waiting.
Attempts to lock a mutex and waits indefinitely.
Validates a sir_textstyle and splits it into its component parts.
Sets the sir_textstyle for a sir_level (see sir_default_styles).
Retrieves the sir_textstyle for a sir_level (see sir_default_styles).
Retrieves the platform value for a component part of a sir_textstyle.
Combines component parts of a platform text style value into its final form.

memberdef.name: _SIR_L_START

detaileddescription.para: Magic number used to determine if the library has been initialized.
The maximum size of an error message generated by the OS.
The error message used when an error is not resolved.
